t: Psalm 132
A song of ascents.
Lord,*spn remember David and*ld all his self-denial.
He*pn swore an oath to the Lord,*s he*ld made a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:
“I*ln will not enter my house or*ld go to my bed,
I*ln will allow no sleep to my eyes or*ld slumber to my eyelids,
till*ln I find a place for the Lord,*s a*ld dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
We*pn heard it in Ephrathah, we*ld came upon it in the fields of Jaar:
“Let*ln us go to his dwelling place, let*ld us worship at his footstool, saying,
‘Arise,*ln Lord,*s and come to your resting place, you*ld and the ark of your might.
May*ln your priests be clothed with your righteousness; may*ld your faithful people sing for joy.’ ”
For*pn the sake of your servant David, do*ld not reject your anointed one.
The*pn Lord*s swore an oath to David, a*ld sure oath he will not revoke: “One*ln of your own descendants I*ld will place on your throne.
If*ln your sons keep my covenant and*ld the statutes I teach them, then*ln their sons will sit on*ld your throne for ever and ever.”
For*pn the Lord*s has chosen Zion, he*ld has desired it for his dwelling, saying,
“This*ln is my resting place for ever and ever; here*ld I will sit enthroned, for I have desired it.
I*ln will bless her with abundant provisions; her*ld poor I will satisfy with food.
I*ln will clothe her priests with salvation, and*ld her faithful people will ever sing for joy.
“Here*pn I will make a horn grow for David and*ld set up a lamp for my anointed one.
I*ln will clothe his enemies with shame, but*ld his head will be adorned with a radiant crown.”
